alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued May 20 at 2:46PM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL DEPRESSION 02W NEWLY FORMED SOUTH OF POLOWAT... .NEW INFORMATION... A Tropical Storm Warning has now been issued for Satawal in Yap State and for Ulul and Polowat in Chuuk State. A Typhoon Watch has now been issued for Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands, and Satawal in Yap State, Ulul and Polowat in Chuuk State. .Watches/Warnings... A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the following locations, Satawal in eastern Yap State and Ulul and Polowat in western Chuuk State. A Typhoon watch is in effect for the following locations, Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. A Tropical Storm Warning means that Tropical Storm Conditions, including damaging winds of 39 to 73 mph, are expected within 24 hours or are already occurring. A Typhoon Watch means that Typhoon conditions are possible within the next 48 hours somewhere within the specified area. All persons in the watch and warning areas should review their preparedness plan and be ready to implement it should a warning be issued for their area. In order to make the best decisions...be sure that you understand the terminology and definitions associated with tropical cyclone events. .STORM INFORMATION... At 1 PM ChST...the center of Tropical Depression 02W was located near Latitude 5.6N...Longitude 149.0E. This was about 610 miles south-southeast of Guam. Storm Motion was north-northwest. Storm intensity was 30 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... A Typhoon Watch has now been issued. A more detailed statement will follow shortly. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan shortly. It will provide important details regarding the evolving tropical cyclone threats and their potential impacts upon the area. ...A TYPHOON WATCH IS NOW IN EFFECT...
info.instruction: For those under a watch or warning...now is the time to initiate preparations according to your typhoon disaster plan specific to your home or business. For those nearby...review your typhoon disaster plan and become ready to act if a watch or a warning is later issued for your area. It is important to actively listen for forthcoming information from your local National Weather Service office and emergency management agency.
